examples.text: The <w>squarrose</w> surface of the material felt abrasive against the skin.
Because of its <w>squarrose</w> texture, the rock was easy to grip while climbing.

senses.sense_definition: Having scales, small leaves, or bracts that spread widely or bend outward from the stem; used in botany.

examples.text: The botanist identified the plant by its <w>squarrose</w> calyx, which curved sharply outward.
This species features <w>squarrose</w> leaves that project at nearly right angles from the stalk.

senses.sense_definition: Having scales that stand upright or spread out at right angles to the surface, typically describing a shell; used in zoology.

examples.text: The marine biologist examined the <w>squarrose</w> shell found in the reef.
Small organisms often hide within the <w>squarrose</w> projections of the coral.
